TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: The situation schedule this adds to the situation scheduler if this shift type is opted into as an additional source.

TunableTuple.name: desired_sim_count_multipliers
TunableTuple.description: Tunable tested multiplier to apply to the desired sim count.

TunableList.name: multipliers

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableList.name: entries
TunableList.description: A list of tuples declaring a relationship between days of the week and desire curves.

TunableTuple.description: The first value is the day of the week that maps to a desired curve of population by time of the day. days_of_the_week population_desire_by_time_of_day M,Th,F time_curve_1 W,Sa time_curve_2 By production/design request we do not support multiple population curves for the same day. e.g. if you want something special to occur at noon on a Wednesday, make a unique curve for Wednesday and apply the changes to it.

TunableTuple.name: days_of_the_week
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

TunableList.name: walkby_desire_by_time_of_day
TunableList.display: Walkby Desire By Time Of Day
TunableList.description: Each entry in the map has two columns. The first column is the hour of the day (0-24) that maps to a desired list of population (second column). The entry with starting hour that is closest to, but before the current hour will be chosen. Given this tuning: hour_of_day desired_situations 6 [(w1, s1), (w2, s2)] 10 [(w1, s2)] 14 [(w2, s5)] 20 [(w9, s0)] if the current hour is 11, hour_of_day will be 10 and desired is [(w1, s2)]. if the current hour is 19, hour_of_day will be 14 and desired is [(w2, s5)]. if the current hour is 23, hour_of_day will be 20 and desired is [(w9, s0)]. if the current hour is 2, hour_of_day will be 20 and desired is [(w9, s0)]. (uses 20 tuning because it is not 6 yet) The entries will be automatically sorted by time.

TunableTuple.name: desired_walkby_situations
TunableTuple.description: Tuning that expresses a desire to populate the world with a specific number of Sims and associating them with an entry from available weighted situations.

TunableVariant.name: desired_sim_count
TunableVariant.description: The number of Sims desired to be participating in the situation.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A literal value that is to be used as the lower and upper bound of an interval. This allows both literal and range interval tunings in the same TunableVariant without having to manually set the lower and upper bounds to the same value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The upper and lower bounds.

TunableTuple.name: random_in_range
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: disable_churn
Tunable.description: If checked, we disable churn for this shift change. That means we only fire the situation on shift change, not in between shifts. So if you have a situation in this shift and it ends, we don't spin up another one on the next churn (based on churn interval). Basically means you want a one shot situation, fire and forget. If unchecked, we will try to maintain the desired number of situations at every churn interval during this shift change.

TunableList.name: weighted_situations
TunableList.description: A weighted list of situations to be used while fulfilling the desired Sim count.

TunableTuple.name: params
TunableTuple.description: Situation creation parameters.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A set of tests that must pass for the situation and weight pair to be available for selection. *IMPORTANT* The only participants that work are ones available globally, such as Lot and ActiveHousehold. Only use these participant types or use tests that don't rely on any, such as testing all objects via Object Criteria test or testing active zone with the Zone test.

TunableTuple.name: weight_multipliers
TunableTuple.description: Tunable tested multiplier to apply to weight. *IMPORTANT* The only participants that work are ones available globally, such as Lot and ActiveHousehold. Only use these participant types or use tests that don't rely on any, such as testing all objects via Object Criteria test or testing active zone with the Zone test.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TdescFragTag.name: subject_filter_tests
TdescFragTag.description: These tests will be run once per subject. If the subject participant of this loot action resolves to multiple objects, each of those objects will be tested individually. Any subject that fails this test will be ignored by this loot. This will have no effect on whether we consider the loot to have passed testing on on other subjects or targets. We can use this in cases where we want to give loot based on some criteria like 'All active household members that are dogs get this loot'. These tests will have no effect on 'run tests first' as they are only used for participant filtering and not to determine loot success. The resolver used for these tests is a SingleObjectResolver based on subject sim. This means that test should generally be testing against 'Actor' and should not assume the presence of additional participants that may be present in the containing loot. Ask a GPE if you have questions.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: The test to decide whether the loot action can be applied.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description: Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used. e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications. e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

TunableList.name: narrative_threshold_links
TunableList.description: A mapping between the event listener to a narrative link that will be activated if progress of that event type hits the tuned threshold. For example, if this narrative has the following narrative threshold link: { key type: GoldilocksListener value_type: Interval: -10, 10 below_link: TooCold_Goldilocks above_link: TooHot_Goldilocks } ... any Narrative Progression Loot tagged with the GoldilocksListener event will increment this instance's narrative_progression_value. If it ever goes above 10 or below -10, the corresponding narrative is activated and this narrative will complete. NOTE: All active narratives' progression values begin at 0.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The progression event that triggers the narrative transition if a threshold is met.

TunableVariant.name: below_link
TunableVariant.description: The narrative that is activated if the lower threshold is passed.

TunableTuple.name: interval
TunableTuple.description: The interval defines the upper and lower bound of the narrative thresholds. If any of the thresholds are crossed, the corresponding narrative is activated.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: fail_if_not_a_business
Tunable.description: If checked, fail if the zone is not a business. If unchecked, pass if the zone is not a business.

Tunable.description: If checked, test will pass if the zone is npc-owned. If unchecked, test passes if the zone is NOT npc-owned.

TunableTuple.name: is_business_open
TunableTuple.description: Test if the zone specified by the zone id is an open business.

TunableVariant.name: is_apartment
TunableVariant.description: If checked, test will pass if the zone is an apartment. If unchecked, test passes if the zone is NOT an apartment. Useful in aspiration tuning, to discriminate between property types in tests of lot value. Allows 'Own a House worth X' and 'Own an Apartment worth X'

TunableTuple.name: Is_or_is_not_apartment_zone
TunableTuple.display: Is Or Is Not Apartment Zone
TunableTuple.description: Test whether the zone is an apartment or not.

Tunable.name: consider_multi_unit_an_apartment
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will consider multi unit(for residential rental) to be apartments when testing them against the apartment check.

Tunable.name: consider_penthouse_an_apartment
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will consider penthouses to be apartments when testing them against the apartment check.

Tunable.name: is_apartment
Tunable.description: If checked, test will pass if the zone is an apartment. If unchecked, test passes if the zone is NOT an apartment.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If checked, this zone must be reserved. If not checked, it must be unreserved.

Tunable.name: use_source_venue
Tunable.description: If enabled, the test will test the source venue instead of the active venue. For example, the Community Lot instead of the active Marketplace. Testing the active venue is the default.

TunableVariant.name: venue_tier
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify that the zone's venue is at the tuned tier. If 'no valid tier' is selected, this test will be True if either the current venue doesn't have tiers or if it does but it doesn't currently meet any of their requirements.

Tunable.name: tier_number
Tunable.description: The index of the tier to test. This test will return true if this tier is active and false otherwise. This should be the index of the tier in the tier list and not any player-facing index. For instance, if a tier list had a single tier, that tier would be 0, and if a second tier were added, that second tier would be 1.

TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.
